snippet: California is considering a new system of car insurance that drivers would pay for through fees at the fuel pump, so the cost would depend more heavily on how much they drive than on traditional factors like what type of car they use or where they...
lead_paragraph: California is considering a new system of car insurance that drivers would pay for through fees at the fuel pump, so the cost would depend more heavily on how much they drive than on traditional factors like what type of car they use or where they live. Insurance companies and trial lawyers hate the idea, which is intended to ease out-of-control increases in insurance costs and the huge problem of uninsured drivers.

headline.main: Big Change Sought in Auto Insurance
